Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Supraglottic Airway Devices in Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy

Trial_Design.evidence: 90 patients aged 20-65 years with ASA Physical Status Grade 1 and 2 were randomised into three groups of 30 each

Participants.evidence: Conducted at a tertiary care center, 90 patients aged 20-65 years with ASA Physical Status Grade 1 and 2

Intervention.evidence: compare the efficacy and safety of three supraglottic airway devices (SADs)—LMA-Supreme (LMA-S), i-gel, and Baska mask

Objective.evidence: This study aims to compare the efficacy and safety of three supraglottic airway devices

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was oropharyngeal leak pressure (OLP) measured immediately after insertion and 30 minutes during carboperitonium

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using closed sealed envelopes, and allocation was concealed

Number_Randomised.evidence: 90 patients aged 20-65 years with ASA Physical Status Grade 1 and 2 were randomised into three groups of 30 each

Result_Outcome.evidence: OLP was significantly higher in the Baska mask group (31.61 ± 4.3 cmH2O) compared to the i-gel (28.27 ± 3.4 cmH2O) and LMA-S (29.42 ± 3.9 cmH2O) groups (p = 0.005)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events such as sore throat, dysphagia, and dysphonia were similar across groups
